[[northern hardwood forest]], wetlands | biome_share = | biome1 = | biome1_share = | geology = | geology1 = | plant = [[Quercus rubra|Red Oak]], [[Eastern White Pine]] | plant1 = | animal = | animal1 = | established_type = | established = | management_body = [[Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation]] | management_location = | management_lat_d = | management_lat_m = | management_lat_s = | management_lat_NS = | management_long_d = | management_long_m = | management_long_s = | management_long_EW = | management_elevation = | visitation = | visitation_year = | free_type = Nearest city | free = [[Spencer, Massachusetts]] | free1_type = | free1 = | map = Massachusetts Locator Map.PNG | map_caption = Location of Spencer State Forest in Massachusetts | map_locator = Massachusetts | map_first = yes | website = [http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/central/spen.htm Spencer State Forest] | footnotes = }} '''Spencer State Forest''', located in [[Spencer, Massachusetts]], is a 965 acre (391 ha) forest and recreation reserve managed by the [[Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation]]. The 92 mile (148 km) [[Midstate Trail (Massachusetts)|Midstate Trail]] passes through the state forest. The [[Massachusetts|Commonwealth of Massachusetts]] also conducts logging in some parts of the property. ==Geography== Spencer State Forest is divided among three non-contiguous parcels. The most notable of these, located in south Spencer, is the Howe Pond parcel, an estate formerly belonging to [[Elias Howe]], the inventor of the [[sewing machine]]. The Howe Pond parcel (sometimes referred to as Howe Park) includes a mill pond and dam constructed by the inventor. Swimming is permitted in the pond; lifeguards are present in season. The Howe Pond parcel also includes picnic tables and outdoor grills. It is located off [[Massachusetts Route 31]] via Howe Pond Road. The Midstate Trail passes through a parcel of Spencer State Forest located in north Spencer, in the area of Turkey Hill Brook. A primitive [[lean-to]] for overnight campers is located on the property atop the 1,014 foot (309 m) [[drumlin]] Buck Hill. A parking lot is located off McCormick Road in Spencer. The overall geography includes hilly terrain, creeks, wetlands, and transitional [[Oak-hickory forest|oak-hickory]] to [[Northern hardwood forest|northern hardwood]] forest types. ==References== *''The Midstate Trail Guide'', 5th edition (2006).
